intro: Trachyandra patens, commonly known as the silver flax lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces white to pale green flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the base of the plant. Trachyandra patens is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils. It is also valued for its resilience to drought and its ability to form dense clumps over time.
